Product Title: Wagon Train: Season 7
Review Date: 2018/09/06
Store: Robert Horton  (Actor),     Frank McGrath  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Westerns
Product Description: ['Special edition 8 DVD Set. One of the longest running and most popular of all the television westerns, Wagon Train topped the ratings for eight seasons in the late 1950s and 1960s. These 32 color episodes of the 7th season are fully restored from their original NBC Universal masters by TMG, which is proud to present them on DVD.']
Average Rating: 4.8

Spencer's Mountain (DVD)
Maureen O'Hara  (Actor),     Henry Fonda  (Actor),     Delmer Daves  (Director, Producer, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
['Product Description', "Spencer's Mountain (DVD)", 'Academy Award winner Henry Fonda stars with Maureen O\'Hara as thepatriarch of a rural West Virginia family, a family that lives andstrives for a better life on the slopes of Spencer\'s Mountain.ClaySpencer (Fonda--On Golden Pond, 12 Angry Men) and his wife, Olivia(O\'Hara--The Parent Trap), have worked hard to rear their nine children.And they are filled with pride when their eldest son, Clayboy (JamesMacArthur--Swiss Family Robinson, "Hawaii Five-O"), graduates from highschool at the head of his class and dreams of being the first Spencer togo to college. But, even though Clay is the best employee at the localmill, there isn\'t enough money to pay for Clayboy\'s tuition at theuniversity. Now, the entire family will work hard, suffer and sacrificehopes to help the Clayboy live his dream in this classic family film.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Long before Henry Fonda played an irascible patriarch in', 'On Golden Pond', ', he played an equally crusty family man in this warmly rustic, 1963 drama', "Spencer's Mountain", ', based on an Earl Hamner Jr. novel that later inspired the television series', 'The Waltons', '. Fonda plays Clay Spencer, a fiercely independent, hard-drinking, foul-mouthed Wyoming laborer who believes in God but rejects (to his tiny community\'s consternation) organized religion. Scraping together enough money to build a new house for his wife (Maureen O\'Hara) and nine children, Spencer runs into an obstacle to both his plans and family pride when his college-bound son (James MacArthur) romances the daughter of Spencer\'s boss. Director Delmer Daves whips up a kind of morose schmaltz out of the earnest material, but it\'s Fonda\'s grit and heartland integrity that carry the day and establish some self-effacing wit. Some nice features here, including interviews with Fonda and a short documentary, "Spencer\'s Mountain: Grand Teton Premiere."', '--Tom Keogh']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Rating Trend:** The user maintains an impressive average rating of 4.8, demonstrating consistent satisfaction overall, though they have recently shown a slight dip in response to newer films. Their fondness for classic media remains pronounced, as evidenced by their latest purchase.

- **Nostalgia:** A strong connection to past experiences continues to define the user’s viewing habits, particularly through their enjoyment of familiar narratives and classic genres. Their latest interest in Westerns reaffirms this preference.

- **Content Preferences:** The user gravitates towards genres such as Western, Action, Drama, and Kids & Family films. They seek out productions that delve into meaningful themes like family values and personal sacrifice, with a recent focus on classic Western titles that capture their interest.

- **Director/Producer Recognition:** Preference for established filmmakers persists, as the user engages with renowned actors and respected directors, particularly in classic formats.

- **Emotional Connection:** The user values films that evoke nostalgia, appreciating the comfort of rewatching beloved works while remaining open to exploring classic titles. Their latest interaction reinforces their love for heartfelt storytelling typical of Westerns.

Overall, this user thrives on classic media characterized by quality narratives, emotional depth, and a robust connection to timeless family themes, blending nostalgia with a willingness to discover enduring stories from the past.
